text.0: they who are glancing forth like women on their way doers of mighty deeds swift racers rudras sons.
text.1: the maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow in sacrifices they delight the strong and wild.
text.2: grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained the rudras have established their abode in heaven.
text.3: singing their song of praise and generating might they have put glory on the sons whom pṛśni bare.
text.4: when children of the cow they shine in bright attire and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments.
text.5: they drive away each adversary from their path and following their traces fatness floweth down.
text.6: when mighty warriors ye who glitter with your spears oerthrowing with your strength een what is neer oerthrown.
text.7: when o ye maruts ye the host that send the rain had harnessed to your cars the thoughtfleet spotted deer.
text.8: when ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer urging the thunderbolt o maruts to the fray.
text.9: forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud and moisten like a skin the earth with waterfloods.
text.10: let your swiftgliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions come ye forward with your arms.
text.11: sit on the grass a wide seat hath been made for you delight yourselves o maruts in the pleasant food.
text.12: strong in their native strength to greatness have they grown stepped to the firmament and made their dwelling wide.
text.13: when viṣṇu saved the soma bringing wild delight the maruts sate like birds on their dear holy grass.
text.14: in sooth like heroes fain for fight they rush about like combatants fameseeking have they striven in war.
text.15: before the maruts every creature is afraid the men are like to kings terrible to behold.
text.16: when tvaṣṭar deft of hand had turned the thunderbolt golden with thousand edges fashioned more skilfully.
text.17: indra received it to perform heroic deeds vṛtra he slew and forced the flood of water forth.
text.18: they with their vigorous strength pushed the well up on high and clove the cloud in twain though it was passing strong.
text.19: the maruts bounteous givers sending forth their voice in the wild joy of soma wrought their glorious deeds.
text.20: they drave the cloud transverse directed hitherward and poured the fountain forth for thirsting gotama.
text.21: shining with varied light they come to him with help they with their might fulfilled the longing of the sage.
text.22: the shelters which ye have for him who lauds you bestow them threefold on the man who offers.
text.23: extend the same boons unto us ye maruts give us o heroes wealth with noble offspring.
